titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the John Cope Caldwell Papers MSS.0066

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-10-05 13:29:39 -0500.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 14 small and 2 large day-books of Asian, African, and South American travels. Holograph. Three brief autobiographies(1951)- typescript and 2 biographies typescript. Travel schedules- 98 schedules from 1950 to 1962.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Outgoing correspondence of 569 letters, chronologically arranged by days and months. Letters are typewritten, carbon copies. Few are mimeographed. 36 undated letters.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 7 containers. Incoming correspondnece of 3,022 letters, 30 telegrams, alphabetically arranged. Letters are typewritten. with the exception of a few Holograph. Few are carbon copies. There are 196 illegible and unsigned letters.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Chronologically arranged by year. Articles and reports from Nashville, Tennessee, papers. Also numerous statements, which are typewritten, are included. These statements refer to activities of various government officials and Caldwell's opinion of these individuals. Also' a statement of Communist activities before the Internal Security Commission.

Magazine and Newspaper articles, material by Caldwell. Articles and short publications by Caldwell, dated and undated. Chronologically arranged by the year. Serial articles to brief references; mostly of social and political concerns.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Dated and undated. Chronologically arranged by years. Serial articles to brief references; mainly of social and political concerns. Typewritten and mimeographed.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Books arranged alphabetically by titles. Typewritten, carbon copies. Family, The Clarke Story, Communism in Our World, The Eagle and his R.0.K.1s, Far East Travel Guide, Far Pacific Travel Guide, From Chiang Kai shek's Diaries, I Went to School in Red China, The Korea Story, Let's Visit America's Ambassadors, Let's Visit Argentina, Let's Visit Australia, Let's Visit Brazil, Let's Visit Canada, Let's Visit Central America, Let's Visit Ceylon, Let's Visit Chile, Let's Visit China, Let's Visit Columbia, Let's Visit India, Let's Visit Indonesia, Let's Visit Japan, Let's Visit Korea, Let's Visit Mexico, Let's Visit Middle East, Let's Visit New Zealand, Let's Visit Pakistan, Let's Visit Peru, Let's Visit the Philippines, Let's Visit the South Pacific, Let's Visit Southeast Asia, Let's Visit Thailand, Let's Visit Venezuela, Let's Visit Vietnam, Let's Visit West Africa, Let's Visit the West Indies, Ling Ceng and the Payoff, Manpogee, a Story of Korea, Our Neighbors in Africa, Our Neighbors in Brazil, Our Neighbors in India, Our Neighbors in Korea, Our Neighbors in Peru, The Overseas Chinese, The Pilleys of Borneo, Recollections of the Marshall Mission, Rush Me More Orphans, South Korea - Democracy or Dictatorship, South of Tokyo, Still the Rice Grains Green, The Story of Japan, We the People, What's it Like on Formosa, When Budda Came to Bathe, Untitled Manuscript

odd.head: General
odd.p: Weekly serial stories for Sunday Digest and Sunday Pix. Arranged by chronology. Typewritten. China Coast Family, Terror by Night, The Tiger Hunter.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Typewritten and holograph. 9 sets of lecture notes.

did.unittitle: Television and radio notes and addresses

odd.head: General
odd.p: Typewritten and chronologically arranged. One short undated announcement.

did.unittitle: Questions and notes on Chiang Kai-shek

odd.head: General
odd.p: Sections of the General's diary and answers to Caldwell's questions.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Papers are in English and Chinese. Typewritten.

did.unittitle: Publisher contracts and other legal documents

odd.head: General
odd.p: Southern Observer. Two copies which are arranged chronologically. Caldwell was the "Book
Review Editor", or "Literary Editor".
Book Reviews amd Book Advertisements. Undated or arranged by year.
Lecture announcements and advertisements.
Letters of U. S. soldiers to unwed mothers in Japan. Arranged chronologically.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 343 photographs of people, places, and things, photographed by Caldwell on his trips to Asia, South America, Europe, and Africa. Completed 2/10/69.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Outgoing correspondence of 252 letters. Chronologically arranged by days and months, letters are typescript and carbon copies. Four undated letters.

did.unitdate: 7 Aug. 15, 1967 (to Joan Butler), Nov. 25, 1966 (to Richard J. Walsh, Jr.), Dec. 2, 1966(to Richard J. Walsh, Jr.)

odd.head: General
odd.p: Incoming correspondence of 189 letters and 9 post cards. Alphabetically arranged, letters are typescript, holograph, and carbon copies. One letter without surname.

did.unittitle: Manuscripts, jacket copies, gallies, dummies, and miscellaneous notes

odd.head: General
odd.p: Material includes 18 typescript and carbon copies of manuscripts etc., alphabetically arranged.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Material consists of 4 reviews of Caldwell's books. Alphabetically arranged by author: James Conaway; William J. Curtis; Virginia Kirkus; Edith Weigle.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Approximately 15 clippings, dealing mainly with countries about which Caldwell has written.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Thirty-one photographs of people, places, and things in Asia, Central America, and Australia.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous. 2 calling cards; 2 records; several bills and receipts; a contract between John C. Caldwell and The John Day Company; a map of Central America.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 168 letters, typed. Nine undated letters in last folder. Listed alphabetically.

did.unitdate: April 23, 1969 - zeroxed copy of letter to Mrs. Grace Guerini

odd.head: General
odd.p: Arranged according to date. One card and 95 letters. Includes 3 unidentified letters dated Aug. 12, 1968 to "John", Oct. 15 to "Roberta", April 9, 1968 to "Ruth and family."

did.unittitle: Manuscript Materials - original MSS, carbon copies, revisions, jacket copies, etc.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Alphabetically arranged: Far Pacific Travel Guide, Let's Visit Afghanistan, Let's Visit Canada(Revisions, also from Japan, South Pacific, Venezuela, Brazil), LV Formosa (Revision, also for Turkey, West Indies), LV Ireland, LV Germany, LV India, LV Malaysia, LV Micronesia, LV Middle Africa, LV Middle East, LV Nigeria, LV Southeast Asia, LV the USA, LV West Africa, LV Yugoslavia, Massage Girl, New Travel Guide.
